title: How to Clean and Polish Metal with Nevr Dull

steps.headline: Gather your materials (see Thing's You'll Need below).
steps.description: Nevr-Dull is a little oily; it's best to gather what you need (and change into work clothes) before starting.

steps.headline: Tear a piece of wadding from the container.
steps.description: It doesn't need to be large, each piece holds more oil than you might think.

steps.headline: Rub the wadding over the metal!
steps.description: Depending on the metal's tarnishing you might need to apply a fair amount of pressure to squeeze out more of the oil. Go over each area a few times, rubbing back and forth in small circles or following the metal's grain.

steps.headline: Clean up unwanted oil on non-metal areas by quickly wiping it off with the paper towel.
Let the oil dry onto the metal.
steps.description: This should be pretty quick, it should take less than 5 minutes. While you're waiting, go ahead and return the wadding to the container. It can be reused later.

steps.headline: Polish the metal to a lustre using the soft rag.
steps.description: Go over each area until the metal doesn't feel oily.
